results.title: The Money or the gun = The International year of the patronising bastard (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Martin Coombes, Mark Fitzgerald and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: A special episode of “The money or the gun” which looks at the community’s attitudes to the disabled. Andrew Denton interviews members of the public and of the disabled community in an attempt to promote a less patronising approach to the physically handicapped. Also known as “The International Year of the Patronising Bastard”. This program has won international awards.

results.title: Vintage: A History of Wine. Eps. 7 & 8
results.creator_credit: Christopher Ralling, Michael Gill, Channel Four, Malone Gill Productions and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description: Sipping stars recounts the history of champagne, from its invention by Dom Perignon during the reign of Louis XIV, the addition of the bubbles by the British during the reign of Charles II and the introduction of mass production methods by La Veuve Clicquot which led to its international success. “Wine and war” shows how the sweet fortified wines, particularly Madeira and Port were embraced by the British and Americans when French and German wines became unobtainable during the Napoleonic wars.

results.title: Buongiorno Italia! [kit]
results.creator_credit: Alan Wilding, Maddalena Fagandini and BBC
results.brief_description: A kit for the Italian for beginners’ course, “Buongiorno Italia!”, containing three 60 minute audio cassettes for pronunciation practice, a copy of “Teachers’ Notes” and a copy of the student text for the course. See also the double video sets, “Buongiorno Italia!” programs 1-10 and 11-20.

results.title: Julie Stafford's taste of life : the video
results.creator_credit: Malcolm Dwyer, Chris Weir, AAV Australia and Martin and Rosenthal Pictures
results.brief_description: Best selling cookery writer Julie Stafford invites you to prepare a variety of mouth-watering recipes for breakfast, lunch, children’s meals and dinners for everyday and for special occasions. Julie also gives a brief outline of healthy foods to eat, shows how to choose and store them and gives an introduction to some common herbs. A weekly menu planner is included.

results.title: Did You Used to Be R. D. Laing?
results.creator_credit: Andrew Feldmar, Kirk Tongas, Tom Shandel and Third Mind Productions
results.brief_description: Scottish psychiatrist, R.D. Laing, who died in 1989 shortly after this film was made, gained a reputation for his radical objection to conventional psychiatry. He opened the discipline to question in his books, “The Divided Self” and “Politics of Experience”. This video is a compilation of a series of public lectures and private conversations made by Laing shortly after his sixtieth birthday. He is revealed to be a charismatic and consummate storyteller who draws on his thirty-five years of pondering the fundamental issues of living, loving, suffering and healing.

results.title: Sabotage = A Woman alone
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Ivor Montagu, Sir Michael Balcon and Gaumont
results.brief_description: The lights fail in a local cinema and the angry audience harass the young woman in the ticket box. Her husband, the cinema manager, will soon become the focus of an investigation into political sabotage on a grand scale - a plan to rob the entire city of electricity. This early Hitchcock classic, based on Joseph Conrad’s “The secret agent”, stars Sylvia Sydney, Oscar Homolka and Jon Loder. The video also includes outtakes from Hitchcock’s “Psycho”, the shower scene, which Hitchcock explains.

results.title: Tales of Helpmann : A Portrait of Sir Robert Helpmann
results.creator_credit: Don Featherstone, Don Featherstone Productions and Primetime Television
results.brief_description: A skilfully compiled documentary of Sir Robert Helpmann that combines lavish film extracts, rare black and white film, noteworthy photographic stills from shows and interviews with the stars that knew him. Protege of Pavlova and Fonteyn’s first partner, Helpmann was the most versatile theatrical talent of his time as he traversed careers in dance, acting, choreography, theatre directing and film performance.
results.title_for_label: Tales of Helpmann : A Portrait of Sir Robert Helpmann

results.title: English at Work. - Eps. 7-9.
results.creator_credit: Karl McPhee, Ray Quint, Diane Sundin and SBS-TV
results.brief_description: Episode 7, “Paying tax”, follows a group of employed and unemployed young people to illustrate how the Australian taxation system works. In “Working together” workers and employers at a car factory find that co- operation and dialogue can go a long way in removing problems between staff and management. In episode 9, “Reading and writing”, we discover that problems in effective communication and literacy are common and often the reason for poor work performance.

results.title: Jude the Obscure
results.creator_credit: Hugh David, Martin Lismore and BBC
results.brief_description: A television adaptation of Thomas Hardy’s novel which tells the story of the doomed Jude Fawley, a bright but poor stonemason. Trapped into marriage with Bella he is unable to realise his ambitions of education at Christminster. When Bella leaves him for Australia he meets his cousin Sue with whom he begins a long and tortuous relationship with tragic consequences, seeming to realise his aunt’s belief that marriage and the Fawley’s are not a possible combination. Stars Robert Powell, Alex Marshall and Fiona Walker.

results.title: Talking Trade
results.creator_credit: Monica Pellizzari, Kay Donovan, Australia. Office of Multicultural Affairs and Australia. Special Broadcasting Service
results.brief_description: Looks at ways Australia could expand trade to other countries, particularly the Arab world, by drawing on the language skills of its ethnic population. The video looks at examples of industries and individuals who have benefited by acknowledging their cultural roots, maintaining their language and recognising their own potential, for the key to trade with other countries is communication and understanding of other cultures. Accompanied by Teacher’s notes.
